item.title: Commercial MOC
item.description: Commercial MOC Civil engineering and the decisions made within it are all dictated by the commercial arrangements between the involved parties.

item.title: Compensation Event (CE)
item.description: Compensation Event (CE) A compensation event is a reassessment of cost or the allocated time to complete a task due to events outside the control of the Subcontractor.

item.title: Contract
item.description: Contract Every contract essentially boils down to three components, and a contract cannot be legally binding without any of them. These are:

item.title: Priced Contract
item.description: Priced Contract Priced contracts are where a lump sum of work is allocated for a project, and money is released under different conditions.

item.title: Target Cost
item.description: Target Cost The Target Cost contract type differs from the Priced Contracts in that the risk is shared between the contractor and the client, in that a pre-agreed “pain/gain” share is agreed whereby any savings are shared between the client and contractor, as well as any losses as a result from exceeding the agreed price.

item.title: Z Clauses
item.description: Z Clauses Z Clauses are a key part of the contract which can change and alter the way the contract functions.
